meanings.definition: To disturb or harm someone in a physical or sexual way.
meanings.sent1: The bully was molesting the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for molesting innocent victims.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept molesting the sleeping dog's tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm was molesting the coastline, causing massive destruction.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves were molesting the fragile sandcastle, washing it away.

meanings.definition: To pester or harass someone persistently.
meanings.sent1: The persistent salesman kept molesting customers with his offers.
meanings.sent2: The telemarketer was constantly molesting people with unwanted calls.
meanings.sent3: The annoying fly wouldn't stop molesting the picnic-goers.
meanings.sent4: The paparazzi were molesting the celebrity, trying to get a photo.
meanings.sent5: The overprotective parent was always molesting their child about safety.

meanings.definition: To interfere with or meddle in something.
meanings.sent1: The curious toddler was molesting the buttons on the remote control.
meanings.sent2: The hacker was caught molesting the company's confidential data.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was molesting the garden, digging up plants.
meanings.sent4: The nosy neighbor was always molesting in other people's business.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind was molesting the fragile branches of the tree, causing them to sway.
